intro: Diplopterys cabrerana, commonly known as Yoco, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its roots are the primary source of the stimulant compound yohimbine, which has been used in traditional medicine. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also of interest in modern pharmacological research.
